intro: Pauridia serrata subsp. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered pauridia, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its slender, branched stems and opposite leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. The flowers are small, white, and clustered in inflorescences, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The subspecies is distinguished by its pale, almost white flowers, which contrast with its dark green foliage.
